newsitem.title: TURKEY: Turkey's president approves anti-Islamist govt.
newsitem.headline: Turkey's president approves anti-Islamist govt.

text.p: Turkish President Suleyman Demirel on Monday approved an anti-Islamist coalition government led by Mesut Yilmaz, Anatolian news agency said.
"The president...approved the Turkish republic's 55th government, under the leadership of Mesut Yilmaz," the agency said.
Secularist Yilmaz's government is a minority coalition of three parties that is supported by a fourth parliamentary grouping.
Yilmaz must now face a confidence vote in parliament within around 10 days. A wave of resignations from an opposing conservative party have given him an apparent majority in the 550-member assembly.
The government is being set up to prevent the Islamists of outgoing caretaker Prime Minister Necmettin Erbakan from returning to power.
Erbakan, modern Turkey's first Islamist leader, resigned two weeks ago under pressure from the secularist army.
